TITLE: Croatia rings in the New Year as a fully integrated EU member
SUMMARY: It marked a fresh start for the small Balkan nation of 4 million that captured international attention three decades ago as the site of a brutal war that left nearly a quarter of its economy in ruins.

TITLE: A powerful storm in California is causing flooding, road closures and power outages
SUMMARY: The so-called atmospheric river storm was pulling in a long and wide plume of moisture from the Pacific Ocean. Flooding and rock slides closed portions of roads across Northern California.

TITLE: North Korea's Kim orders 'exponential' expansion of nuclear arsenal
SUMMARY: Some experts say Kim Jong Un's push to make more nukes and new weapons systems reflects his hopes to solidify future negotiating power as he heads into prolonged tensions with the U.S. and its allies.

TITLE: Short on community health workers, a county trains teens as youth ambassadors
SUMMARY: In Fairfax County, Va., the health department is training high school students to become health ambassadors in underserved communities and get a leg up on future careers in public health.

TITLE: Despite infighting, it's been a surprisingly productive 2 years for Democrats
SUMMARY: Despite more than a handful of setbacks, President Biden has delivered on several major promises since 2021, some with bipartisan support. Those compromises could be harder with the new Congress.

TITLE: Singer Anita Pointer of The Pointer Sisters has died at age 74
SUMMARY: The Pointer Sisters won three Grammy Awards and had 13 U.S. top 20 hit songs between 1973 and 1985, Anita Pointer's publicist said. The 1983 album "Break Out" went triple platinum.

TITLE: Immerse yourself in this colossal desert 'City' — but leave the selfie stick at home
SUMMARY: Michael Heizer began work on his massive installation in the Nevada desert more than 50 years ago. One of the largest artworks in the world, it cost $40 million (so far) and is now open to the public.

TITLE: A bill to fight expensive prison phone call costs heads to Biden's desk
SUMMARY: Congress recently passed legislation that will give federal regulators greater authority to limit the costs of prison phone calls.

TITLE: A stampede during a New Year's event in Uganda kills at least 9 people
SUMMARY: The incident at a shopping mall in a suburb of Kampala, the capital, appears to have occurred at midnight when an event emcee encouraged people to go outside to watch a fireworks display, police said.

TITLE: A U.N. official met with a Taliban leader over a ban on women working for NGOs
SUMMARY: Major international aid agencies suspended operations in Afghanistan after the Taliban banned women from working for nongovernmental organizations in a series of measures rolling back women's rights.

TITLE: Researchers say the FBI's statistics on hate crimes across the country are flawed
SUMMARY: Thousands of law enforcement agencies nationwide did not provide statistics to the FBI due in large part to a transition from a legacy crime reporting system that has existed since the 1920s.

TITLE: California dries out — and digs out — after a powerful storm dumps rain and snow
SUMMARY: The heavy rain and snowfall around much of the state snarled traffic, closed major highways, knocked power out and created dangerous floodwaters.

TITLE: Canada and Australia impose COVID testing requirements on travelers from China
SUMMARY: Australia and Canada join other countries including the U.S., U.K., India, Japan and several European nations in imposing tougher COVID-19 measures on Chinese travelers amid fears of new variants.

TITLE: An inflection point for GOATs: Please quiet quit these 'banished words' moving forward
SUMMARY: In their annual "Banished Words" list, the faculty of Lake Superior State University also suggest removing from your vocabulary overused phrases like "does that make sense?" and "it is what it is."

TITLE: Leftist Lula da Silva is sworn in as president to lead a divided Brazil
SUMMARY: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva assumed office as Brazil's new leader Sunday, just three years after being released from prison on corruption charges and 12 years after his first two terms as president.

TITLE: At least 10 people are dead and 20 escaped after a prison riot in Juárez, Mexico
SUMMARY: The riot occurred at the notorious Cereso state prison in Juárez. The mayor, Cruz Pérez Cuéllar, told local media that armed gunmen had entered the prison.

TITLE: Evacuation warnings are in place in parts of California after storm brings flooding
SUMMARY: The heavy rain and snowfall around much of the state snarled traffic, closed major highways, knocked power out and created dangerous floodwaters.

TITLE: Actor Jeremy Renner is hospitalized after suffering accident while plowing snow
SUMMARY: The "Avengers" star Jeremy Renner sustained serious injuries while he was plowing snow, the actor's representative said. The actor has a home in Nevada, but it is unclear where he was hurt.

TITLE: 4 passengers are dead after 2 helicopters collide over an Australian beach
SUMMARY: Two helicopters collided in an Australian tourist hotspot Monday in a crash that killed four passengers and drew emergency aid from beachgoers enjoying the water during the southern summer.

TITLE: Thousands queue to pay tribute as the body of retired pope Benedict XVI lies in state
SUMMARY: Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI 's body lay in state in St. Peter's Basilica on Monday as thousands of people filed by to pay tribute to the pontiff who shocked the world by retiring a decade ago.

TITLE: States are kicking off new legislative sessions. These are the top issues
SUMMARY: In the coming weeks state legislatures across the country will swear in newly-elected lawmakers. What are the top issues state governments will focus on in 2023?

TITLE: When someone turns 100, these volunteers are there to make sure they're honored
SUMMARY: For the past three decades, the Centenarians of Oklahoma volunteers have made it their mission to celebrate as many centenarians as they can. To date, they've honored more than 2,700 and counting.

TITLE: California was hit with historic New Year's rainfall, power outages and flash floods
SUMMARY: Strong storms caused power outages and severe flooding in parts of California. A busy highway was closed after a river overflowed its banks near Sacramento. More rain is expected mid week.

TITLE: RNC Comms Director discusses Congressman-elect George Santos's scandal
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to Republican political consultant Douglas Heye (high) about the deceptions of Rep.-elect George Santos and the response from the GOP.

TITLE: What we can expect from the economy in 2023
SUMMARY: What can we expect from the economy in 2023? NPR's Rob Schmitz puts the question to David Wessel, director of the Hutchins Center at the Brookings Institution.

TITLE: Morning news brief
SUMMARY: The New Year in Ukraine was met with more airstrikes. What state legislatures are focusing on this year. And, a look at Pope Benedict's complicated legacy.

TITLE: She was a popular yoga guru. Then she embraced QAnon conspiracy theories
SUMMARY: Themes like everything is connected, nothing happens without a purpose, and nothing is what it seems are central to both yoga philosophy and conspiratorial thinking.

TITLE: A woman accused Steven Tyler of sexually assaulting her in the 1970s
SUMMARY: A 65-year-old said she first met and was sexually assaulted by the Aerosmith frontman when she was 16, according to a new lawsuit filed under a California law that extended the statute of limitations.

TITLE: President Biden has made choosing diverse federal judges a priority
SUMMARY: He has set records in his first two years for the sheer numbers of jurists, dozens of them women. He helped confirm 11 Black women to the appeals courts, more than all other presidents combined.

TITLE: Time is fleeting. Here's how to stay on track with New Year's goals
SUMMARY: As we dive into another new year of resolutions, managing time is the key to success. And learning to organize our time around our goals may mean saying 'no' to activities that don't align.

TITLE: A Colorado library will reopen after traces of meth were found in the building
SUMMARY: The main library in Boulder, Colorado, had been receiving increased reports of drug use in the bathrooms over a four-week span. It has been closed since late December.

TITLE: Actor Jeremy Renner is in critical but stable condition from snow-plowing accident
SUMMARY: The "Avengers" star Jeremy Renner sustained serious injuries while he was plowing snow, the actor's representative said. The actor has a home in Nevada, but it is unclear where he was hurt.

TITLE: 13 bison were killed in a road accident near Yellowstone National Park
SUMMARY: The bison were hit by a semi truck. In the winter months, bison will move toward paved roads to make their travel easier.

TITLE: In county jails, guards use pepper spray and stun guns to subdue people in mental crisis
SUMMARY: An investigation finds that corrections officers in Pennsylvania use physical force on people who may be unable to comply with orders due to a mental health condition.

TITLE: Don't think of Africa as a hungry child, says a champion of Africa's food prowess
SUMMARY: If you think that African countries have nothing to contribute to the global food supply, Ndidi Nunweli would like you to think about what you eat daily.

TITLE: Russia says 63 soldiers were killed in a Ukrainian attack in Donetsk
SUMMARY: The attack was one of the deadliest strikes on the Kremlin's forces since the start of the war 10 months ago. It came as Moscow unleashed a new barrage of multiple exploding drones on Ukraine.

TITLE: The family of the Idaho slaying suspect expresses sympathy, support
SUMMARY: Relatives of a man arrested in Pennsylvania in the slayings of four University of Idaho students expressed sympathy for the victims' families but also vowed to support him.

TITLE: Here's what 2023 has in store, as predicted by experts in 1923
SUMMARY: A researcher collected century-old newspaper clippings with predictions in fields ranging from public health to beauty to transportation. Some have proven more accurate than others.

TITLE: Tennis great Martina Navratilova has been diagnosed with throat and breast cancer
SUMMARY: The 66-year-old tennis legend has been diagnosed with early stages of throat and breast cancer. "The prognosis is good," her agent told NPR.

TITLE: A third atmospheric river storm is set to add to misery in California's flooded areas
SUMMARY: Parts of California were still under flash flood warnings Monday, with yet another deluge of rainfall set to arrive midweek.

TITLE: Fred White, drummer for the band Earth, Wind & Fire, has died
SUMMARY: White, the younger brother of the band's founder and principal songwriter Maurice White, joined the group in the mid-1970s and went on to lay the backbone for hits like "September" and "Shining Star."

TITLE: Russia says 63 soldiers were killed in a Ukrainian attack
SUMMARY: The attack was one of the deadliest strikes on the Kremlin's forces since the start of the war 10 months ago. Ukraine claimed to have killed hundreds of Russian conscripts, but details are murky.

TITLE: Monday Night Football game postponed after player collapses on the field
SUMMARY: The Monday night game between the Buffalo Bills and Cincinnati Bengals was suspended after Bills safety Damar Hamlin collapsed on the field. Hamlin was in critical condition, the NFL said.

TITLE: Buffalo Bills player Damar Hamlin is in critical condition after collapsing in a game
SUMMARY: The Monday night game between the Buffalo Bills and Cincinnati Bengals was suspended after Bills safety Damar Hamlin collapsed on the field. Hamlin was in critical condition, the NFL said.

TITLE: Gangsta Boo, a former member of Three 6 Mafia, dies at 43
SUMMARY: Lola "Gangsta Boo'' Mitchell was found dead Sunday in Memphis, Tennessee, her hometown at the age of 43. The cause of death has not been released.

TITLE: Condolences pour in for Damar Hamlin, who's in critical condition after an NFL game
SUMMARY: Condolences for Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin poured in from across the sports world after Hamlin collapsed in a game Monday night against the Cincinnati Bengals.

TITLE: January is often a big month for layoffs. Here's what to do in a worst case scenario
SUMMARY: From calling creditors to announcing your job loss on social media, a solid game plan can make a layoff sting a lot less.

TITLE: McCarthy scrambles for votes to be elected Speaker of the House
SUMMARY: Republicans take control of the House on Tuesday. The first vote is to elect a new House speaker but Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., still doesn't have the majority of needed to win the gavel.

TITLE: Hurricane-damaged roofs in Puerto Rico remain a problem. One group is offering a fix.
SUMMARY: Five years after Hurricane Maria, PRoTechos, a local nonprofit, helps repair damaged roofs the government overlooked or that were fixed poorly. It also trains people to make future repairs themselves.

TITLE: Condolences pour in from across the sports world for Damar Hamlin
SUMMARY: Support for Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin poured in from across the sports world and for a charity crowdfunding effort for children that Hamlin started after he collapsed in a game Monday night.

TITLE: A golden age for nonalcoholic beers, wines and spirits
SUMMARY: There are many more drinking options this Dry January if you like the taste of alcoholic drinks but don't like the effects of alcohol.

TITLE: Fans raise more than $3 million for Damar Hamlin's toy drive
SUMMARY: Fans showed their support for the Buffalo Bills safety by pouring more than $3 million into a fundraiser he started for kids in his hometown. Donations were still pouring in as of Tuesday morning.

TITLE: Tributes pour in from across the sports world for Damar Hamlin
SUMMARY: Support for Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin poured in from across the sports world and for a charity crowdfunding effort for children that Hamlin started after he collapsed in a game Monday night.

TITLE: Rally car driver and DC Shoes co-founder Ken Block dies in a snowmobile accident
SUMMARY: Ken Block, an action sports legend who also co-founded Hoonigan Racing, died on Monday at age 55 after his snowmobile fell backwards on a steep slope.

TITLE: McCarthy scrambles for votes to be elected speaker of the House
SUMMARY: Republicans take control of the House on Tuesday. The first vote is to elect a new House speaker but Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., still doesn't have the majority of needed to win the gavel.

TITLE: An influx of 300 migrants forces closure of a national park in the Florida Keys
SUMMARY: The U.S. National Park Service estimated that some 300 migrants arrived in the Dry Tortugas National Park over the past couple days. The park is about 100 miles north of Havana, the Cuban capital.

TITLE: Who is Damar Hamlin? The Buffalo Bills safety keeps Pittsburgh and his family close
SUMMARY: The world is waiting for updates about Hamlin, who is in critical condition after suffering a cardiac arrest during Monday night's game against the Cincinnati Bengals. This is his second NFL season.

TITLE: An airline worker died after being 'ingested into the engine' of a plane, NTSB says
SUMMARY: The National Transportation Safety Board is investigating an incident with the Embraer 170 aircraft which killed an American Airlines worker on Saturday in Montgomery, Ala.

TITLE: Fans raise more than $4 million for Damar Hamlin's toy drive
SUMMARY: Fans showed their support for the Buffalo Bills safety by pouring more than $4 million into a fundraiser he started for kids in his hometown.

TITLE: McCarthy loses first vote for House speaker, forcing a second voting round
SUMMARY: California GOP Rep. Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary votes to become speaker of the House in a first round of voting after 19 House Republicans voted against him.

TITLE: NASA Apollo astronaut Walt Cunningham has died at age 90
SUMMARY: Cunningham piloted the first manned Apollo mission, a key step in the drive to reach the moon, but he never flew in space again. He was a physicist who later became known as a climate-change skeptic.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty to fraud and other charges tied to FTX's collapse
SUMMARY: The co-founder and former CEO of FTX pleaded not guilty to eight criminal counts related to the spectacular collapse of his crypto exchange.

TITLE: Mastermind of the Varsity Blues college admission scandal is about to learn his fate
SUMMARY: Rick Singer pleaded guilty in 2019 to selling what he called "a side door" into top universities. The scheme snared dozens of wealthy clients, from actors to business titans and big-shot lawyers.

TITLE: McCarthy loses second vote for House speaker as voting heads to a third round
SUMMARY: Rep. Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary votes to become House speaker in another round of voting after 19 House Republicans voted against him. Voting is expected to go to a third round.

TITLE: McCarthy loses third vote for House speaker as GOP opposition grows
SUMMARY: Rep. Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary votes to become House speaker in another round of voting — the third — after 20 House Republicans voted against him.

TITLE: Rana Ayyub fights for press freedom in India despite harassment and death threats
SUMMARY: Rana Ayyub, an investigative journalist in India, has constantly faced online harassment, death threats and the full force of India's judiciary system throughout her career

TITLE: U.S. Soccer investigates Coach Gregg Berhalter after 1991 domestic violence episode
SUMMARY: U.S. Soccer says it learned of the allegation against men's national team head coach Gregg Berhalter last month - a week after the team was knocked out of the World Cup with a loss to the Netherlands.

TITLE: The Bills-Bengals game looked like it might resume. Then the players left the field
SUMMARY: After a traumatic injury to Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin, players had seemingly been preparing to continue their game. But they left the field moments later, and never returned.

TITLE: Did Damar Hamlin experience commotio cordis? What to know about the rare phenomenon
SUMMARY: It involves the impact of a specific force to the chest at a specific moment in the cardiac cycle. One cardiologist told NPR that what happened to Hamlin was likely "a perfect storm of events."

TITLE: House leadership is in limbo as McCarthy loses 3 rounds of voting for speaker
SUMMARY: Rep. Kevin McCarthy failed to secure the necessary votes to become House speaker in another round of voting — the third — after 20 House Republicans voted against him.

TITLE: The FDA finalizes rule expanding the availability of abortion pills
SUMMARY: The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday finalized a rule change that broadens availability of abortion pills to many more pharmacies, including large chains and mail-order companies.

TITLE: The U.S. is reopening visa and consular services at embassy in Cuba
SUMMARY: The U.S. Embassy confirmed this week it will begin processing immigrant visas, with a priority placed on permits to reunite Cubans with family in the U.S., and others like the diversity visa lottery.

TITLE: Video game testers approve the first union at Microsoft
SUMMARY: Quality assurance workers at Microsoft's ZeniMax Studios began voting on a union in December. Microsoft pledged to remain neutral through the process and let employees decide if they want to join.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to $940M after no winner
SUMMARY: The Mega Millions jackpot increased to an estimated $940 million after another drawing Tuesday resulted in plenty of losers but not a single grand prize winner

TITLE: This baby could push India past China to become the world's most populous country
SUMMARY: Any day now, the United Nations will declare India's population the largest in the world. The country's next generation is poised to be healthier, more literate — and more female — than ever before.

TITLE: Minimum wage just increased in 23 states and D.C. Here's how much
SUMMARY: Workers earning minimum wage in 23 states and the District of Columbia got a raise over the New Year's holiday, according to the Economic Policy Institute.

TITLE: For the Bills' Damar Hamlin, this NFL season was an opportunity to 'cherish'
SUMMARY: Hamlin wasn't supposed to be a starter for the Bills. But a slew of injuries — including one that sent a close friend to the hospital midgame — both opened a door and made him count his blessings.

TITLE: Maine lobster industry wins reprieve but environmentalists say whales will die
SUMMARY: The $1.7 trillion spending bill just signed into law contains a 6-year delay on new federal fishing regulations that would have kept lobster fishermen off the water in some areas for months at a time.

TITLE: How our perception of time shapes our approach to climate change
SUMMARY: Climate goals can feel distant. But climate change is a happening right now. Speed up the benefits for taking action, psychologists say, if you want leaders and others to pay attention and act.

TITLE: Many ERs offer minimal care for miscarriage. One group wants that to change
SUMMARY: A group of doctors trains health care providers to treat miscarriage in the emergency department. This could be increasingly important in states where abortion is outlawed.

TITLE: The 118th Congress is off to a historic start. Here's a look at the first day
SUMMARY: In the Senate, Mitch McConnell became the longest serving Senate leader in history. Meanwhile, the House failed to elect a speaker<a href="https://www.npr.org/2023/01/03/1146600160/mccarthy-scrambles-for-votes-to-be-elected-speaker-of-the-house">

TITLE: The Mega Millions jackpot climbs to $940M after no single winner is drawn
SUMMARY: The Mega Millions jackpot increased to an estimated $940 million after another drawing Tuesday resulted in plenty of losers but not a single grand prize winner

SUMMARY: <em>Avengers

TITLE: This was supposed to be Kevin McCarthy's moment. Instead, GOP chaos reigns
SUMMARY: This was supposed to be Kevin McCarthy's moment, one he had contorted himself into political knots to get to.

TITLE: Southwest Airlines apologizes and then gives its customers frequent-flyer points
SUMMARY: Southwest Airlines says it will award the travelers who were caught in the surge of canceled flights during the holidays 25,000 frequent-flyer points, an award worth more than $300 in flights.

TITLE: A man killed women he deemed 'immoral' — an Iranian film fictionalizes the story
SUMMARY: The real-life "Spider Killer" murdered 16 women in Iran between 2000 and 2001. The case inspired Holy Spider, which has resonated abroad during a time of amplified state violence in Iran.

TITLE: Damar Hamlin had to be resuscitated a second time, his uncle says
SUMMARY: The Buffalo Bills safety remains in critical condition after a seemingly routine tackle caused his heart to stop beating. His uncle says doctors are aiming to get him off a ventilator soon.

TITLE: Author Maia Kobabe: Struggling kids told me my book helped them talk to parents
SUMMARY: In 2020, <em>Gender Queer

TITLE: Jeremy Renner's snow tractor injuries were a tragic accident, a Nevada sheriff says
SUMMARY: The 51-year-old "Avengers" star was seriously hurt near Lake Tahoe on New Year's Day when he was run over by his own snowcat after using it to free a vehicle stuck in 3 feet of fresh mountain snow

TITLE: The underage stars of a hit 1968 version of 'Romeo & Juliet' sue over their nude scene
SUMMARY: Olivia Hussey, then 15, and Leonard Whiting, then 16, allege sexual abuse, sexual harassment and fraud, and are seeking more than $500 million from Paramount Pictures.

TITLE: The Black family who won the return of Bruce's Beach will sell it back to LA County
SUMMARY: The return of the property was hailed as a step toward righting the wrongs inflicted by systemic racism. Now, the parties say, the $20 million sale will help restore some of the wealth stripped away.

TITLE: An Israeli far-right leader's Al-Aqsa visit sparks outrage and calls for U.N. meeting
SUMMARY: Israel is lobbying against calls for an urgent session of the U.N. Security Council, following Tuesday's visit by far-right national security minister Itamar Ben-Gvir to a sensitive holy site.

TITLE: 'American Caliph' revisits one of the most dramatic hostage crises in U.S. history
SUMMARY: In 1977, gunmen led by a charismatic Muslim leader stormed three locations in Washington, D.C., taking more than 100 people hostage. Journalist Shahan Mufti examines the incident in a new book.

TITLE: Tesla driver is charged with intentionally plunging his family off a California cliff
SUMMARY: Two adults and two children inside the vehicle survived the fall of 250-300 feet and the driver was arrested on charges of attempted murder and child abuse, the California Highway Patrol said.

TITLE: Rick Singer, head of the college admissions bribery scandal, gets 42 months in prison
SUMMARY: Prosecutors had sought six years for Singer's role in the scheme to get the children of wealthy parents into universities through cheating and bribery.

TITLE: Cryptocurrency giant Coinbase strikes a $100 million deal with New York regulators
SUMMARY: A review found that the exchange's compliance program violated state laws, making it "vulnerable to serious criminal conduct." It will pay a $50 million fine and spend the rest beefing up oversight.

TITLE: Damar Hamlin shows 'signs of improvement,' Buffalo Bills say
SUMMARY: The Buffalo Bills safety remains in critical condition after a seemingly routine tackle caused his heart to stop beating. The 24-year-old is expected to remain in intensive care, the team said.

TITLE: The House last struggled to elect a speaker 100 years ago. Here's what happened
SUMMARY: Both Kevin McCarthy and the nominee for speaker a century ago represented a party establishment regarded with hostility by a potent faction of the party. They became the embodiment of its grievances.

TITLE: Iran releases a top actress who was held for criticizing the crackdown on protests
SUMMARY: Taraneh Alidoosti, the 38-year-old star of the Oscar-winning 2016 film <em>The Salesman

TITLE: California holds its breath as an atmospheric river and bomb cyclone approach
SUMMARY: The powerful system was seen "undergoing bombogenesis"  off California's coast, the NWS office in Sacramento said, referring to its rapid intensification.

TITLE: FBI says two men attacked Washington's electric grid in order to commit a robbery
SUMMARY: On Christmas Day, an act of sabotage cut off power for thousands of people near Tacoma, Wash. Federal agents have charged two men with conspiracy, saying they used the outage to rob a local business.

TITLE: Allegations against U.S. soccer coach were made by player Gio Reyna's parents
SUMMARY: Information about a 1991 incident between Gregg Berhalter and his now-wife were shared with U.S. Soccer by Danielle Reyna, whose son Gio had limited playing time at the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

TITLE: Amazon CEO says company will layoff more than 18,000 workers
SUMMARY: The layoffs represent the single largest number of jobs cut at a technology company since the industry began aggressively downsizing last year.

TITLE: Thousands pour into St. Peter's as the funeral of retired Pope Benedict XVI begins
SUMMARY: Bells tolled Thursday for the funeral of Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI, the German theologian who made history by retiring, as thousands of mourners packed St. Peter's Square.

TITLE: 8 people are found fatally shot in a Utah home, including 5 children
SUMMARY: The eight victims were found when police did a welfare check at the residence, according to a statement by city officials in Enoch, a small town located 245 miles south of Salt Lake City.

TITLE: Members of the military will now get 12 weeks of parental leave
SUMMARY: The new guidance is for birthing and non-birthing parents, including parents who recently adopted a child and parents who used a surrogate.

TITLE: People in Tokyo wait in line 3 hours for a taste of these Japanese rice balls
SUMMARY: Onigiri Bongo has served the humble onigiri, or rice ball, for 60 years. The current owner is the widow of the original owner, whom she married after discovering the restaurant as a newcomer to Tokyo.

TITLE: Abortion pills should be easier to get. That doesn't mean that they will be
SUMMARY: Changes by the FDA mean patients won't have to schedule in-person exams to get a prescription. That opens the door for more pharmacies to provide the medication. But not everyone will have access.

TITLE: These 21 House members didn't vote for Kevin McCarthy. Here's what they want
SUMMARY: McCarthy is still short of the votes he needs to be speaker, and it's because of a staunch, anti-establishment, intransigent far-right group that wants government to do a lot less.

TITLE: Looking to watch porn in Louisiana? Expect to hand over your ID
SUMMARY: The state's new law went into effect this week with the intent of protecting minors from pornographic content online, according to lawmakers.

TITLE: Powerful storm slams into California, bringing power outages and fears of flooding
SUMMARY: The powerful system was seen "undergoing bombogenesis"  off California's coast, the NWS office in Sacramento said, referring to its rapid intensification.

TITLE: America needs carpenters and plumbers. Try telling that to Gen Z
SUMMARY: Baby boomers are aging out of jobs they long dominated like builders, farmers, mechanics Young workers aren't clamoring to take their place.

TITLE: Thousands mourn Benedict XVI at funeral celebrated by pope
SUMMARY: Bells tolled Thursday for the funeral of Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI, the German theologian who made history by retiring, as thousands of mourners packed St. Peter's Square.

TITLE: Amazon CEO says company will lay off more than 18,000 workers
SUMMARY: The layoffs represent the single largest number of jobs cut at a technology company since the industry began aggressively downsizing last year.

TITLE: Opioid settlement pushes Walgreens to a $3.7 billion loss in the first quarter
SUMMARY: Last month, Walgreens finalized a settlement with state and local governments to resolve opioid abuse lawsuits. Despite the legal charge, the company beat Wall Street forecasts.

TITLE: Putin orders a temporary cease-fire in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered Russian forces to observe the cease-fire for 36 hours starting Jan. 6. Orthodox Christmas is traditionally celebrated by many on Jan. 6 and 7.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond warns that it may go bankrupt
SUMMARY: The struggling retailer says it's exploring all options, including restructuring and filing for bankruptcy relief.

TITLE: Sam Phillips, in a 'Morning Edition' interview, talked about Elvis' first recording
SUMMARY: The man who introduced the world to Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash and Jerry Lee Lewis was born 100 years ago. In 1993, former <em>Morning Edition

TITLE: Investigators reveal new information tying Idaho murders to Bryan Kohlberger
SUMMARY: Bryan Kohlberger, a 28-year-old criminology PhD student at nearby Washington State University, has been charged with four counts of first-degree murder and one count of burglary.

TITLE: Man charged in Takeoff's death is released on $1 million bond
SUMMARY: Patrick Xavier Clark, charged with murder in November fatal shooting of Migos rapper Takeoff in Houston, has been released on $1 million bond.

TITLE: Maryland artist chosen to create U.S. Capitol statute of teen who fought segregation
SUMMARY: Steven Weitzman will sculpt the bronze statue of Barbara Rose Johns, a 16-year-old who led protests against school segregation in Virginia. It will replace a statue of Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee.

TITLE: Damar Hamlin shows 'substantial improvement' in the past 24 hours, physicians say
SUMMARY: The Buffalo Bills team said Thursday that while Hamlin remains "critically ill," he appears to be "neurologically intact."

TITLE: Sam Phillips, who introduced the world to Elvis and Johnny Cash, would be 100 today
SUMMARY: Phillips launched the careers of legends including Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash and Jerry Lee Lewis. The rock and roll pioneer spoke to <em>Morning Edition

TITLE: 'Pineapple express' storm brings more floods and topples trees in California
SUMMARY: Another huge winter storm is slamming California's coastal and inland areas with strong winds and heavy rain and snow. It's downed power lines and closed roads, and is linked to at least two deaths.

TITLE: How the Jan. 6 committee used TV tactics and dark humor in its case against Trump
SUMMARY: Reporter Luke Broadwater says the committee hired a former news producer to hit Trump where it hurt: "His whole career was built on television, and they were able to use that very medium against him."

TITLE: Got neck and back pain? Break up your work day with these 5 exercises for relief
SUMMARY: Hunching over screens takes a toll. Movement researchers say you can prevent pain from accumulating by taking quick breaks for movement. Here are 5 exercises to try that take a minute or less.

TITLE: Maryland artist chosen to create U.S. Capitol statue of teen who fought segregation
SUMMARY: Steven Weitzman will sculpt the bronze statue of Barbara Rose Johns, a 16-year-old who led protests against school segregation in Virginia. It will replace a statue of Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee.

TITLE: Millions of workers are subject to noncompete agreements. They could soon be banned
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission has proposed a new rule that bans the use of noncompete agreements, calling them an exploitative practice that suppresses wages and hampers innovation.

TITLE: A stubborn La Nina and manmade warming are behind recent wild weather, scientists say
SUMMARY: In a world getting used to extreme weather, 2023 is starting out bonkers. Meteorologists are saying it's typical weather weirdness, with a boost from human-caused climate change.

TITLE: Investigators reveal new information they say ties Idaho murders to Bryan Kohberger
SUMMARY: One of the victims' roommates saw a strange man in the house that night, and a DNA sample from a knife sheath found in a victim's bed appears to be a strong match for Kohberger, investigators say.

TITLE: Damar Hamlin is awake and shows 'substantial improvement,' physicians say
SUMMARY: While the 24-year-old Buffalo Bills safety remains critically ill, physicians in Cincinnati say he appears to be "neurologically intact."

TITLE: Sony says its PlayStation 5 shortage is finally over, but it's still hard to buy
SUMMARY: Over two years after the PlayStation 5 was released, Sony announced the shortage is finally over. Consumers should "have a much easier time" finding a console, an exec said.

TITLE: Peloton agrees to pay a $19 million fine for delay in disclosing treadmill defects
SUMMARY: The fitness company had received over 150 reports of safety incidents linked to its popular Tread+ machine — including the death of a child — before notifying regulators, a U.S. safety agency said.

TITLE: Investigators reveal new information they say ties Idaho killings to Bryan Kohberger
SUMMARY: One of the victims' roommates saw a strange man in the house that night, and a DNA sample from a knife sheath found in a victim's bed appears to be a strong match for Kohberger, investigators say.

TITLE: As Damar Hamlin shows 'substantial improvement,' Buffalo Bills will play Sunday
SUMMARY: While the 24-year-old Bills safety remains critically ill, physicians in Cincinnati say he appears to be "neurologically intact."

TITLE: California's 'Pineapple Express' relents, with some areas starting cleanup efforts
SUMMARY: Another huge winter storm has slammed California's coastal and inland areas with strong winds and heavy rain and snow. It has downed power lines and closed roads and is linked to at least two deaths.

TITLE: The House last struggled to elect a speaker 100 years ago. Here's what happened
SUMMARY: Both Kevin McCarthy and the nominee for speaker a century ago represented a party establishment regarded with hostility by a potent faction of the party. They became the embodiment of its grievances.

TITLE: Cardiac arrest is often fatal, but doctors say certain steps can boost survival odds
SUMMARY: For the more than 350,000 Americans each year who suffer cardiac arrest outside of a hospital, the prognosis is not always an optimistic one. But quick action with CPR and a defibrillator can be key.

TITLE: Biden's national security adviser is hopeful war over Taiwan can be prevented
SUMMARY: In an exclusive interview at the White House, Jake Sullivan spoke with NPR's Steve Inskeep. They discussed China-Taiwan tensions, the war in Ukraine, and his upcoming trip to Israel

TITLE: A newborn was surrendered to Florida's only safe haven baby box. Here's how they work
SUMMARY: A newborn was surrendered recently under a program that lets people give up an unwanted infant anonymously. There are dozens of baby boxes scattered across the U.S., but the practice is controversial.

TITLE: Tesla's stock lost over $700 billion in value. Elon Musk's Twitter deal didn't help
SUMMARY: The transformational automaker's market cap has dropped by a staggering amount over the past year. Blame new competition, sales that fell short of a lofty target — and a distracted CEO.

TITLE: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano erupts again as the summit crater glows
SUMMARY: Hawaii's Kilauea began erupting inside its summit crater Thursday after scientists detected a glow in webcam images inside the Halemaumau crater.

TITLE: A biotech firm says the U.S. has approved its vaccine for honeybees
SUMMARY: Global honeybee populations have been declining for many years, due to disease, loss of habitat and poor beekeeping practices. A newly approved vaccine helps fight American Foulbrood disease.

TITLE: A rising star in Connecticut politics dies in a collision with a wrong-way driver
SUMMARY: A Connecticut state representative who was considered a rising political star was killed when a wrong-way driver crashed into his vehicle Thursday, state police said. The other driver also died.

TITLE: Violence hits a Mexico cartel stronghold as the son of 'El Chapo' is captured
SUMMARY: Mexico's defense secretary said the military had captured Ovidio Guzmán, a son of the notorious former Sinaloa cartel boss Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán, on Thursday in a pre-dawn operation in Sinaloa.

TITLE: A gray whale gave birth as a whale watching tour looked on
SUMMARY: The crew and passengers aboard the whale watching boats have described it as a once in a lifetime moment. Lucky for you, it was caught on video!

TITLE: The U.S. job market is still healthy, but it's slowing down as recession fears mount
SUMMARY: U.S. employers added 223,000 jobs in December, as the unemployment rate dipped to 3.5%. Despite some high-profile layoff announcements, the overall job market remains tight.

TITLE: West Virginia can keep its ban against transgender school athletes, a judge says
SUMMARY: The judge said he recognized that being transgender is "natural" and "not a choice." But he said one's sex is also natural and "dictates physical characteristics that are relevant to athletics."

TITLE: Trump and two rioters are sued over the death of Capitol Police officer Brian Sicknick
SUMMARY: The officer, who was attacked with chemical spray during the insurrection, suffered a series of strokes and died the day after the Jan. 6 attack.

TITLE: Damar Hamlin is breathing on his own and talking to his family and team
SUMMARY: Physicians at the University of Cincinnati Medical Center, where the 24-year-old is being treated, said Hamlin's breathing tube was removed overnight and he continues to progress "remarkably."

TITLE: Meet Cheryl Johnson, the House clerk managing the speaker votes
SUMMARY: Johnson has served as House clerk since 2019, the fourth woman and second Black person to do so. She's drawn praise from both sides of the aisle for running the speaker vote and maintaining order.

TITLE: Hillary Clinton joins Columbia University as a professor and fellow in global affairs
SUMMARY: The former secretary of state will teach in the School of International and Public Affairs as well as work on global policy initiatives with Columbia World Projects.

TITLE: Police officers and election workers honored 2 years after Capitol attack
SUMMARY: President Biden today will mark two years since the Capitol attack by issuing medals to some of those who defended the Capitol and election officials who resisted pressure to overturn the results.

TITLE: Kevin McCarthy steps closer to the speakership as some GOP holdouts flip
SUMMARY: In the biggest shift since the speaker nominations started, a total of 14 Republicans who previously voted against Kevin McCarthy backed the embattled Californian in a 12th vote.

TITLE: Iran demonstrators vow to continue protests despite ongoing crackdowns
SUMMARY: The protests that have gripped the country since September may have diminished to some extent recently, but demonstrators in Iran reached by NPR insist the protests will not die out or fade away.

TITLE: Five Democratic politicians' homes or offices have been shot at in Albuquerque
SUMMARY: Authorities already had planned to highlight the attacks — then came word of yet another shooting with a political target.

TITLE: FDA approves Alzheimer's drug that appears to modestly slow disease
SUMMARY: An Alzheimer's drug that removes the substance amyloid from the brain has received a conditional approval from the FDA. A large study found the drug decreased the loss of thinking and memory by 27%.

TITLE: Southwest Airlines' holiday chaos could cost the company as much as $825 million
SUMMARY: Southwest Airlines says disruptions that led to more than 16,700 cancelled flights over the holidays will have severe financial consequences for the company.

TITLE: Nate Thayer, rebel reporter who interviewed Pol Pot in the Cambodian jungle, has died
SUMMARY: After tracking him for nearly a decade, Nate Thayer became the last Western correspondent to interview the murderous Khmer Rouge leader. Thayer died at his home in Falmouth, Mass., at age 62.

TITLE: Jen Shah, 'Real Housewives' star, sentenced to 6 1/2 years for telemarketing fraud
SUMMARY: Shah was also ordered to pay more than $6 million in restitution.

TITLE: Biden honors police officers and election workers 2 years after the Capitol attack
SUMMARY: President Biden issued medals to some of those who defended the Capitol and election officials who resisted pressure to overturn the results.

TITLE: RSV recedes and flu peaks as a new COVID variant shoots 'up like a rocket'
SUMMARY: RSV and the flu appear to be receding in the U.S., but COVID is on the rise, new data suggest, driven by holiday gatherings and an even more transmissible omicron subvariant that has become dominant.

TITLE: Congress wasn't always this dysfunctional (except it kind of was)
SUMMARY: You've likely heard lots this week about how rare the repeated failed Speaker votes have been. But is this a new level of dysfunction for Congress?

TITLE: McCarthy within striking distance of winning speaker fight after most detractors flip
SUMMARY: California Republican Kevin McCarthy gained momentum on the fourth day of speaker elections and is inching closer to getting the votes to become the next speaker of the House.

TITLE: WWE's Vince McMahon is back after misconduct investigation
SUMMARY: Vince McMahon is rejoining the board of WWE several months after he retired from the sports entertainment company during an investigation into alleged misconduct.

TITLE: A 6-year-old shot a teacher in a Virginia classroom, police say
SUMMARY: No students were injured in the shooting at Richneck Elementary School, police said. The teacher — a woman in her 30s — suffered life-threatening injuries.

TITLE: Tension on the House floor rises as lawmakers take up a 15th vote for speaker
SUMMARY: Friday night was full of drama and twists and turns, as California Republican Kevin McCarthy inched closer to getting the votes to become the next speaker of the House.

TITLE: Kevin McCarthy elected House speaker after 15 votes and days of negotiations
SUMMARY: Friday night was full of drama and twists and turns, as California Republican Kevin McCarthy eked out a win in the 15th round of voting for the speaker of the House.

TITLE: Global food prices in 2022 hit a record high amid drought and war
SUMMARY: Global prices for food commodities like grain and vegetable oils were the highest on record last year even after falling for nine months in a row, the U.N. Food and Agriculture Organization said.

TITLE: How reparation efforts in Barbados found an international spotlight
SUMMARY: The online buzz over high profile Britons' ties to the trans-Atlantic slave trade put attention on the ongoing reparations push in Barbados, and other Caribbean nations.

TITLE: STOMP closes after 29-year New York run
SUMMARY: The internationally-renowned show exploring the percussive possibilities of the human body and everyday objects ends Jan. 8.

TITLE: 5 low-key ways to get your new year off to a healthy start
SUMMARY: Does the idea of ambitious goal-setting in January turn you off? Try these tips for sustainable self-care instead.

TITLE: Buying an electric car? You can get a $7,500 tax credit, but it won't be easy
SUMMARY: The government is offering a hefty tax credit to buyers of electric vehicles, but taking advantage of it is not straightforward. Here's what you need to know.

TITLE: Iran executes 2 more men detained amid nationwide protests
SUMMARY: There are now four men known to have been executed since demonstrations began in September over the death of Mahsa Amini. All have faced internationally criticized, rapid, closed-door trials.

TITLE: A Black 'Wall Street Journal' reporter was detained while working outside a bank
SUMMARY: The Phoenix Police Department says that it has launched an internal investigation following the arrest of <em>Journal

TITLE: ICE arrests and deportations started to pick up in 2022, a federal report shows
SUMMARY: Immigration arrests doubled this past fiscal year, largely as a result of assisting Border Patrol agents with the surge of migrants on the southern border.

TITLE: California is getting drenched. So why can't it save water for the drought?
SUMMARY: As a bomb cyclone hits California this week and dumps massive amounts of water on the state, some people are asking: why can't we save the water for times when we desperately need it?

TITLE: The fate of America's largest lithium mine is in a federal judge's hands
SUMMARY: West Coast Native American tribes are suing to stop the proposed lithium mine because they consider the land sacred.  Proponents of the Nevada mine see it as vital for electric vehicle production.

TITLE: LA Dodgers cut pitcher Trevor Bauer after his suspension was reduced
SUMMARY: The team is cutting ties with Bauer, whose unprecedented 324-game suspension over sexual misconduct allegations was reduced two weeks ago.

TITLE: The Mega Millions jackpot has soared to $1.1 billion
SUMMARY: No one won the estimated $940 million jackpot Friday, pushing the lottery prize to the third-largest Mega Millions in U.S. history ahead of the next drawing Tuesday night.

TITLE: Harsh winter means misery for many people but happiness for skiers
SUMMARY: The onslaught of storms this winter has disrupted a lot of Americans' lives, but is a boon for skiers — up to a point.
